title: 2026 Midterms: Senate Control Hangs in Balance as Polls Tighten
introText: Control of the Senate hangs in the balance as 2026 midterm polling shows races tightening across key battleground states. Both parties are deploying massive resources to determine the chamber's majority.

content.content: Senate races tighten ahead of midterms

Seven Senate seats are rated as toss-ups, with Arizona, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin showing the tightest margins. The current 51-49 Republican majority means Democrats need to flip just one seat while holding their own.
Senate races are on track to break spending records, with over $1 billion already committed in advertising reservations. Super PACs have become increasingly dominant in competitive races.
Economic concerns and healthcare costs are driving voter preferences. Abortion access remains motivating for Democratic voters, while immigration drives Republican turnout.
